titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania LJS 405: Kitāb al-Siyāsah al-sharʻīyah al-musammá tasʹhīl al-naẓar wa-taʻjīl al-ẓafar.

licence.#text: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts LJS 405: Kitāb al-Siyāsah al-sharʻīyah al-musammá tasʹhīl al-naẓar wa-taʻjīl al-ẓafar. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. note: Numerous notes and stamps on the first folio recto.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Treatise in two chapters, one on the qualities of a good ruler and the other on the art of good government. Partial loss of seal impressions and marginal notes due to trimming.

title: Kitāb al-Siyāsah al-sharʻīyah al-musammá tasʹhīl al-naẓar wa-taʻjīl al-ẓafar.

title.#text: كتاب السياسة الشرعية المسمى تسهيل النظر وتعجيل الظفر

msItem.title: Qualities of a good ruler, f. 1r

supportDesc.extent: 75 leaves : 225 x 160 (180 x 110) mm bound to 225 x 170 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i + 75 + i; [1-75]; three foliations: modern foliation in pencil, upper left recto which is in sync with an earlier foliation in Hindu-Arabic numerals also in pencil in the upper left margin, recto, but is slightly out of sync with another, earlier foliation in ink, upper left recto, which has also been trimmed off in some instances. Catchwords in a different hand, lower left verso.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in naskh in dark brown ink; pointed and vocalized.

binding.p: Modern binding incorporating 19th-century north African covers with flap (Type II) with stamped central mandorla with gold-tooled outline and frame corner decorations; marbled paper pastedowns.

origin.p: Item is undated, likely copied in Egypt between the mid-13th and mid-14th century.

provenance: Formerly owned by Prince Sadruddin Aga Khan; sold at auction as part of his collection at Piasa (Paris), 7 June 1999.
Sold by Sam Fogg Ltd. (London) to Lawrence J. Schoenberg, Mar. 2001.
Gift of Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2011.
